title: Bay City Western High School Gunfire Incident

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Bay City Western High School Gunfire Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report, a police narrative and any other documentations produced in relation to the shooting incident at Bay City Western High School on 11/11/2016. 

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of the press and these records will be used in the public interest. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Daniella Jimenez
Investigative Reporting Workshop.

communications.subject: FWD: Bay County, MI - FOIA Request 2023-377 Processed
communications.communication:
Pursuant to your follow-up please see below the response that was sent. 
  
 Thank you,
Nicole

"On Thu, Jun 15, 2023 at 2:56 pm, Nicole LaDouce (Bay County, MI) wrote:


RE: FOIA Request Request Number: 2023-377 

Dear Daniella Jimenez,

The Bay County Department of Corporation Counsel has received your request for public records and has processed it under the provisions of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MCL 15.231 et seq.

Your request has been GRANTED in part and DENIED in part. The basis for any redactions in the documents provided (or the basis for denying the production of documents in their entirety) is further explained below. The Bay County Sheriff's Office has compiled fifteen (15) pages of documents and thirty-three (33) photographs in response to this request.

Since the time spent searching for this information was less than the time allowable in which to assess fees, charges are waived for processing this request. Accordingly, the responsive records have been released, and you may view and download them by clicking here: Request Number: 2023-377

As indicated above, portions of your request have been denied in part because the information you requested is exempt under FOIA. Accordingly, I have set forth the applicable exemptions for you below. 

Your request has been denied in part because I have found that releasing this information would constitute an unwarranted invasion of privacy. Accordingly, cellular telephone numbers have been redacted and withheld from these records under MCL 15.243(1)(a) & (b)(iii).

The pertinent provision of the Act upon which this response/exemption is based read as follows:

Sec. 13. (1) A public body may exempt from disclosure as a public record under this act any of the following:

(a) Information of a personal nature if public disclosure of the information would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of an individual's privacy.

(b) Investigating records compiled for law enforcement purposes, but only to the extent that disclosure as a public record would do any of the following:

***

iii. Constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.

Disclosing the above-referenced information would constitute an unwarranted invasion of a third-party individual's privacy under the Act. In addition, this information is generally not available to the general public and is not listed in a general public directory. Release of that information to members of the public could also allow their misuse and cause both emotional and economic hardship to those third parties. Finally, releasing the above-described information of those third parties would not assist any member of the public in understanding the function or working of government, as is the promoted intent of the Act.  

If you are dissatisfied with this response, I want to advise you of your appeal rights. You may file a written appeal to the Bay County Executive that specifically states the word “APPEAL” and must give the reason or reasons for reversal of the denial, or if you are appealing a fee, specifically identify how the required fee exceeds the amount permitted. Alternatively, you may seek judicial review of this denial pursuant to MCL 15.240. If you seek judicial review and the Court determines the public body made an improper decision regarding the records sought, you may be entitled to attorney fees and the potential damages outlined in the statute.

Please be assured that Bay County is committed to full compliance with public policies promoting the disclosure of information regarding governmental affairs and the actions of public employees. Bay County’s FOIA Procedures & Guidelines and Public Summary are available upon request or on our website at: https://www.baycounty-mi.gov/CorporationCounsel/FOIA.aspx.

Sincerely,

Nicole LaDouce
FOIA Coordinator

Bay County FOIA Division
515 Center Avenue, Ste. 402
Bay City, Michigan 48708
(989) 895-4131
foia@baycounty.net"

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Deleted Tweets (Everett Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- The 54 deleted tweets mentioned in this tweet: https://web.archive.org/web/20201121030914/https://twitter.com/EverettPoliceWA/status/1329983974374948866
- Any other tweets deleted in 2020
- Any emails since 11/19 mentioning "twitter" or "tweets" (case insensitive)

If other tweets are found to be deleted in 2020, please indicate the tweets that were part of the 54 mentioned in the above tweet. Additionally, if you require additional time to search for deleted tweets other than the initial 54, please provide those in a later installment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bridget Brululo

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 24, 2020, Reference # D005562-112420 
Dear Bridget Brululo, 
The Everett Police Department received a public records request from you on November 24, 2020. You requested the following: 
"To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

- The 54 deleted tweets mentioned in this tweet: https://web.archive.org/web/20201121030914/https://twitter.com/EverettPoliceWA/status/1329983974374948866 
- Any other tweets deleted in 2020 
- Any emails since 11/19 mentioning "twitter" or "tweets" (case insensitive) 

If other tweets are found to be deleted in 2020, please indicate the tweets that were part of the 54 mentioned in the above tweet. Additionally, if you require additional time to search for deleted tweets other than the initial 54, please provide those in a later installment. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Bridget Brululo 

Upload documents directly: https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Feverett-police-department-777%252Fdeleted-tweets-everett-police-department-105132%252F%253Femail%253Djjacobs%252540everettwa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAYsCRk98F8zbnvpaYMvpEE-v4%3A1khm63%3ATB1Exkcj1ot819ysihcOyY4GiCM" 
The next installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the City of Everett Public Records Center. Click the link below this message to login to the Public Records Center and retrieve the records. 
The EPOA twitter account is a private account that is not run by the Everett Police Department.  However, we do have some tweets that we are providing.  I am unable to confirm if these tweets were part of the "54 deleted tweets".  We are also releasing the outlook .pst file of emails containing "tweet" and redaction withholding log. 
We are asking for clarification on emails containing "twitter".  Our standard email signature contains the word twitter as a link to the Everett Police Department twitter account.  Due to this, almost all emails contain "twitter".  My initial search indicated over 9500 emails to review.  It is likely that most of these will not contain the records you are seeking.  Would you be able to provide any alternate search term that would help narrow the search?  Please respond by 9/6/2023.  If we do not receive a response by 9/6/2023, Everett PD will interpret your request to be abandoned and closed. 
If we receive clarification, we estimate the next installment date to this request will be available on or before 9/6/2023.  If public records become available in advance of this estimate we will contact you promptly.  Conversely, if the Everett Police Department encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will contact you promptly with a revised estimated date. 
Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 
Sincerely, 
Brent Flagg 
Everett Police Department 
Public Disclosure Unit 
425-257-8471

title: Chinese Communist Contacts with Scientists in the United States

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chinese Communist Contacts with Scientists in the United States
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records captioned "Chinese Communist Contacts with Scientists in the United States", a program described in a 1975 memo as "Development of selected scientists of ethnic Chinese background as foreign counterintelligence assets to be targeted against People's Republic of China (PRC) personnel and establishments in the U.S. and Canada" (https://www.archives.gov/files/research/jfk/releases/2018/docid-32989624.pdf). This program was previously disclosed to Mara Hvistendahl via FOIA in 2018 (https://theintercept.com/2020/02/02/fbi-chinese-scientists-surveillance/).

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Records captioned "Chinese Communist Contacts with Scientists in the United
    States", a program described in a 1975 memo as "Development of selected
    scientists of ethnic Chinese background as foreign counterintelligence
    assets to be targeted against People's Republic of China (PRC) personnel and
    establishments in the U.S. and Canada"
    (https://www.archives.gov/files/research/jfk/releases/2018/docid-32989624.pdf).
    This program was previously disclosed to Mara Hvistendahl via FOIA in 2018
    (https://theintercept.com/2020/02/02/fbi-chinese-scientists-surveillance/).
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not
    limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone
    Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and
    the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and
    cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and
    companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at
    the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have
    been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the
    destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating
    to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but
    not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said
    records. If previously released records are available, then I request a
    rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are
    located and processed for release.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Paul Galante
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fchinese-communist-contacts-with-scientists-in-the-united-states-151301%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2N1qWBmHuupmUG9e5EmjH-g%3A1qbH1f%3A0lEdrmXmQC3LgiztDh1DDKWONfBLyYzjOpLl6m-CQDY

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Chester Pierce
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Chester Middlebrook Pierce (March 4, 1927 – September 23, 2016) - famed American psychiatrist and author (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chester_Middlebrook_Pierce)

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Incident report for 2012 North Forest High shooting

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Incident report for 2012 North Forest High shooting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any investigative reports produced in relation to the shooting incident at North Forest High School on 1/10/2012.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of the press and these records will be used in the public interest. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julian Wray

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any investigative reports produced in relation to the shooting incident at North Forest High School on 1/10/2012.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of the press and these records will be used in the public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Julian Wray

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2016-2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year, from 2016-2021 (for example, 302 use of force incidents in 2016, 287 use of force incidents in 2017, etc.)

2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used from 2020-2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2020, etc.)

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021.

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021.

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021.

6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021. 

6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021. 

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead. 

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe. Please be advised the County is requesting seven additional time to respond to your request due to research and reviewing of any potential responsive records.  Therefore, the County is invoking subsection (B)(4) of § 2.2-3704 to provide us with seven (7) additional working days to respond to your request. For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Lieutenant Ryan Allen 
Arlington County Police Department

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year, from 2016-2021 (for example, 302 use of force incidents in 2016, 287 use of force incidents in 2017, etc.) 

2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used from 2020-2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2020, etc.) 

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021. 

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021. 

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021. 

6. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained from 2020-2021. 

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead. 

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe. The Police Department has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the FOIA Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. Police Records Request - P001012-020123  Additionally, I have included our ACPD annual report which includes statistics that fulfill your request.  This attachment is also on our website at the following link. Arlington County Police Department

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: County Records Request of April 17, 2023, Reference # C002206-042123 Dear Tom Nash, Arlington County received a public records request from you on April 17, 2023. Your request mentioned: Metadata for all email communications sent or received, including being cced or BCCed, by David Povlitz sent or received between 8/22/2019 and 4/15/2023 
containing at least one of the following keywords: "Amazon'', "Neighbors App" and "Ring". 
The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if there is an email attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if 
not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. Pursuant to Code of Virginia § 2.2-3704(F), the County is permitted to make reasonable charges to cover the County’s actual cost incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for any potential responsive records. Pursuant to Code of Virginia § 2.2-3704(H), when Arlington County determines in advance that charges for producing the requested records are likely to exceed $200, the County can require an estimate deposit. The County requires an estimate deposit that is 50 percent of the estimated costs to be paid before continuing to process your request. The County will not continue to process your request until the estimate deposit is paid. Please let us know if you would like to discuss your FOIA request. Based upon your request, a total of 3,591 emails were identified as containing one of the keywords provided. We have estimated approximately 30 seconds of review for each subject line of the 3, 591 emails. Providing more specific key words or a date range could limit the scope of your request and could result in a lower estimate. You can either reply to this email or call us at either number in the signature block below to discuss further. 
The deposit will be credited toward the final cost of supplying the requested records that will be provided on the final invoice at the same time as the County’s response to your request. If the County’s final costs are more than initially estimated, this will be reflected on the final invoice containing the remainder of the balance to be paid. If the County’s final costs for responding to your request are less than the estimate deposit paid, then this will be reflected on the final invoice and you will be refunded the difference. An invoice will be sent to you for the amount of the estimate deposit in a separate email. Please follow the instructions in that email to make payment. For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. Sincerely, Rachel Healy, FOIA Officer 
Arlington County - Office of the County Attorney 
2100 Clarendon Blvd., Suite 403 Arlington, VA  22201 
(C) 703.843.0687 (T) 703.228.0720

Pursuant to Code of Virginia § 2.2-3704(F), the County is permitted to make reasonable charges to cover the County’s actual cost incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for any potential responsive records.

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

title: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2022) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2022) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2022
communications.communication:
LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2022) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2022

Via email: publicrecordsrequest@lwsd.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2022 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2022.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2022 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2022) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2022
communications.communication:

L.E. Scarr Resource Center

16250 N.E. 74th Street

Redmond WA. 98073
Office: 425-936-1200 • Fax: 425-861-7765


February 1, 2023

MuckRock News
DEPT MR 139886
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115
Dear MuckRock News,

This letter confirms that the District has received your request on February 1, 2023. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.040(1)(c) et seq., I acknowledge your request. This letter serves as the response required by the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.520. You are requesting the following:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2022 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2022.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Please note, the District is currently experiencing an unusually high volume of extensive and complex public records requests and is processing requests in the order received and clarified. Given the unprecedented quantity of pending records requests, the District anticipates it will be able to complete this request by June 30, 2023.
Under the Public Disclosure Act, districts may not charge for locating documents or for inspection. The district will assess a fee of .15 cents per page for any copying. The District will email files to you and does not anticipate a fee.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me at 425-936-1342 or via email at sparthemer@lwsd.org<mailto:sparthemer@lwsd.org>.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Logs (San Diego County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Flight logs for all drone flights, including training flights from January 1 2023 until the date this request is processed.  If KML files or geospatial data exist, please include that as well.
2. Reprimands relating to drones, including misuse of equipment and failure to properly maintain equipment since 2016

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

RE: Public Records Request of August 15, 2023, Reference # S002303-081523 
Dear Dhruv Mehrotra, 
On August 15, 2023, the San Diego County Sheriff's Department received your request for records pursuant to the California Public Records Act (CPRA) wherein you requested the following: Other 
Some of the records you have requested are exempt from disclosure and are not provided in the responsive documents being disclosed to you. 1. Flight logs for all drone flights, including training flights from January 1 2023 until the date this request is processed. If KML files or geospatial data exist, please include that as well. Records under this category are provided; however, redacted pursuant to GC 7923.600 and GC 7922.000. San Diego Sheriff's Dep't does not maintain KML files. 

2. Reprimands relating to drones, including misuse of equipment and failure to properly maintain equipment since 2016 Peace officer personnel records are exempt pursuant to Government Code section 7927.705, incorporating Penal Code section 832.7(a) and 832.8.  Additionally, personnel, medical, or similar files, the disclosure of which would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, are exempt from disclosure pursuant to Government Code section 7927.700. 

Responsive records are available in the Records Request System.  Please log in to your online account and retrieve the records. 
Your request is now closed. 
Sincerely, 
Video Analysis Unit 
San Diego County Sheriff's Department

title: BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020
communications.communication:
BELLEVUE SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2020) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2020

Via email: publicrecords@bsd405.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2020 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2020.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2020 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Village of Fox Lake (NWRWRF), motion to keep arrested employee on payroll, settlements, budget, policies.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

> The Northwest Regional Water Reclamation total budget.
> The Northwest Regional Water Reclamation technology budget.
> The technology policy for employees.
> Administrative leave policies.
> Personnel Records, HR confidentiality policy, list of confidential documents not shared.
> Ryan Kelly personnel file.
> Northwest Regional Water Reclamation Rates for all member organizations.
> The motion and vote to keep Ryan Kelly on the payroll.
> A copy of the 2017 mediation settlement between the Northwest Regional Water Reclamation Facility and the County of Lake.
> A copy of any other settlement agreements with member organizations.
> Roster of the Northwest Regional Water Reclamation board of directors and term expiry dates.
> Roster of Village of Fox Lake Elected officials of March 1, 2023 and term expiry dates.
> Roster of Village of Fox Lake Elected officials as of August 2023 and term expiry dates.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carolyn

communications.communication:
Hello and thank you for your email. The Village of Fox Lake shows your request was submitted after our regular business hours on Friday, August 18, 2023. The Village processes FOIA requests during regular business hours, Monday through Friday, 8am-5pm. Since your request was submitted after regular business hours, your request was received by the Village on Monday, August 21, 2023 after 8am.

The Village of Fox Lake will respond to noncommercial requests within five (5) full working days and commercial request within twenty-one (21) full working days from the date of receipt, August 21st. You should receive a response from us no later than August 28th.

Thank you,

Ashley Magnine
Deputy Clerk/Administrative Assistant

title: Councilmember emails re: Hours and Scheduling Stability 2015–16

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Councilmember emails re: Hours and Scheduling Stability 2015–16
communications.communication:
Dear Council FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails and attachments sent or received by Councilmembers Charles Allen, Phil Mendelson, Vincent Orange, Elissa Silverman, or Brandon Todd between 6/1/2015 and 12/31/2016 that contain either of the (non-case-sensitive) phrases "hours and scheduling stability" or "minimum work week" or the corresponding bill numbers 21-0512, 21-512, 21-0331, or 21-331. 

I am an academic researcher making this request for non-commercial purposes. I will make the responsive records available to the general public through the MuckRock website.

I ask that this request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges prior to fulfilling my request.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

I see that this request was faxed to your office, but I am emailing to make sure that you receive it. Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I am requesting the following records:

All emails and attachments sent or received by Councilmembers Charles Allen, Phil Mendelson, Vincent Orange, Elissa Silverman, or Brandon Todd between 6/1/2015 and 12/31/2016 that contain either of the (non-case-sensitive) phrases "hours and scheduling stability" or "minimum work week" or the corresponding bill numbers 21-0512, 21-512, 21-0331, or 21-331.

I am an academic researcher making this request for non-commercial purposes. I will make the responsive records available to the general public.

I ask that this request be filled electronically, if possible, by e-mail attachment. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges prior to fulfilling my request.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel
Postdoctoral Research Fellow
Rutgers School of Management and Labor Relations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Absolutely any and all files and materials regarding or referencing Daniel Ellsberg, a military analyst whose involvement in what became known as the Pentagon Papers has been widely publicized. His death on June 16, 2023 has been reported by the media [See: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/16/us/daniel-ellsberg-dead.html].

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc.

Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency.

Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials. Please search all relevant indices and databases. An insufficient search would be one that does not check the various locations in which records on or relating to this individuals are stored. 

Please provide materials on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: 2004 Dispatch Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The entirety of the Sevier County Sheriff’s Dispatch Log from 12/23/2004 and 12/24/2004.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Katie King.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 65-WFO-11874
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of the following files: 65-WFO-11874 and 61-HQ-3499. Please include all sub files, bulky files, and enclosures behind file if they exist.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1455124-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Tabulator - Voting Machine - Receipts (Rochester Town Clerk)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Tabulator - Voting Machine - Receipts (Rochester Town Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Purchase Orders and/or Receipts for electronic voting equipment (AKA Tabulators) since 1998. Please include Model Name, Vendor, and Date Purchased at minimum. 
- Audits on any voting equipment (include dates, company, costs) per M. G. L. c. 54 § 33I
- Devices removed (when removed, when originally purchased, reason for removal) 
-Devices with serial numbers and model used in 2020 presidential election.
-Devices with serial numbers and model numbers in current circulation to be used in next election/November 2022. 
- When the name "Sara Cooke" or "Sara Breton" occurred on voting records. Looking for dates I voted. (Please interchange, as name may include middle initial of E. or Elizabeth. For confirmation: Snipatuit Road, Pine Street, Hazel Road, Wall Street are the addresses to cross confirm).  
- In Rochester, under maiden name of Sara Breton, I was a poll worker. Kindly include those dates as to when I was working for the town.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sara Cooke

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jerry Springer
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Gerald Norman Springer (February 13, 1947 - April 27, 2023). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-65415348

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1591406-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Jerry Springer
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Gerald Norman Springer (February 13, 1944 – April 27, 2023) a.k.a. Jerry Springer - American television show host and former politician (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerry_Springer )

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. For reference, the associated file number for these records provided by the FBI is 105-HQ-70374.

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

Please see the following major news article as proof of death: https://www.npr.org/2023/04/27/1172435531/jerry-springer-dies-obituary

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Italo Calvino
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All Records relating to or mentioning Italo Calvino (15 October 1923 – 19 September 1985) - the famous Italian author (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italo_Calvino)

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader
