title: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to any records or files held by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) related to Jason William Mizell, who is also known as Jam Master Jay. Mizell was a founding member of the hip-hop group Run-DMC and a pioneer in the music industry. He was tragically killed on October 30, 2002, at his recording studio in Queens, New York. I am referencing an article from Rolling Stone magazine, published on March 4, 2021, titled "Jam Master Jay Alleged Killer Goes to Trial," which provides some background on the investigation into his death and the subsequent trial of his alleged killer.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), I request that all records be released to me, including any documents, memos, emails, or other materials that reference or relate to Jason William Mizell or his death. Additionally, I request that a key string search be conducted to ensure that all relevant records are provided to me. Specifically, I would like to request that the following key strings be used in the search:

Jam Master Jay
Jason Mizell
Run-DMC
Murder
Homicide
Investigation
Suspect
Arrest
Trial
Evidence
Witness
Statement
Interview
Autopsy
Forensic
Ballistics
Gang
Drug
Criminal
Violence
New York City
I also request any records that may be responsive to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) program.

I would like to remind you that the FOIA reflects a strong presumption in favor of disclosure, and that any exemptions to the Act must be narrowly construed. The Supreme Court has held that the FOIA promotes transparency and accountability in government, and that any exemptions to the Act must be based on specific and narrowly defined grounds. See United States Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989); John Doe Agency v. John Doe Corp., 493 U.S. 146 (1989); and Nat'l Archives & Records Admin. v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004), among other cases.

Therefore, I would like to give notice that I do not consent to any withholding, redaction, or deletion of records that may be responsive to my request, except in cases where the documents are clearly exempt from disclosure under the FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Good Citizen

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request Letter for FBI Records on Jam Master Jay (Jason Mizell)
communications.communication:
Dear FOIPA Appeals Officer,

I am writing to appeal the response I received to my FOIPA request number 1586780000 regarding Jason William Mizell. The response stated that my request was not sufficiently identified because I did not provide my complete name, and that an anonymous request does not meet the requirements of the Department of Justice's FOIA regulations.

However, I believe that case law supports the position that a requester's anonymity does not necessarily preclude access to information under the FOIA. In the case of McGehee v. CIA, the court held that "an agency may not refuse to disclose information merely because it is requested by an anonymous individual" (697 F.2d 1095, 1104 [D.C. Cir. 1983]).

Furthermore, the FOIA provides that upon receipt of a reasonably described request, records can be made available to a "person" (5 USC § 552 [a][3][A]). It does not explicitly require the requester to provide their complete name or any personal information. The Department of Justice's FOIA regulations may require a requester's complete name, but I believe that those regulations cannot override the requirements of the FOIA itself.

Based on the above, I respectfully request that the FBI reconsider its decision to deny my FOIPA request on the basis of my anonymity, and provide access to the requested records. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: U VA perfusion salary request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting, from 01/01/2012 to present, records of: name, position, hire date, official salary or rate of pay (on an annual basis) for anyone with the word 'perfusion' in their job title.

I discussed my request with the Virginia FOIA council and they advised: "Generally speaking, accounting records showing payments made to an individual would be open to public disclosure, but notations regarding the type of pay or reasons for payment may be withheld as personnel information. Please see AO-01-21 which discussed salary/rate of pay, payroll, and accounting records in detail."

Therefore, in addition, I am also requesting accounting records from 01/01/2012 to present showing name and aggregate total annual (calendar year preferred, but  fiscal year acceptable) payments made  to any individuals with the word 'perfusion' in their job title as well.

If you need any further clarification or if there is any way to reduce the labor required to produce these records in this detail, please let me know.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Brent Thye.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request :: V003041-060123
communications.communication:
Dear Tom: I am writing to acknowledge receipt by the University of Virginia of your request for records under the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), Va. Code § 2.2-3700 et seq., for the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting, from 01/01/2012 to present, records of: name, position, hire date, official salary or rate of pay (on an annual basis) for anyone with the word 'perfusion' in their job title.

I discussed my request with the Virginia FOIA council and they advised: "Generally speaking, accounting records showing payments made to an individual would be open to public disclosure, but notations regarding the type of pay or reasons for payment may be withheld as personnel information. Please see AO-01-21 which discussed salary/rate of pay, payroll, and accounting records in detail."

Therefore, in addition, I am also requesting accounting records from 01/01/2012 to present showing name and aggregate total annual (calendar year preferred, but fiscal year acceptable) payments made to any individuals with the word 'perfusion' in their job title as well.

If you need any further clarification or if there is any way to reduce the labor required to produce these records in this detail, please let me know.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Brent Thye. Under FOIA, UVA has five working days to respond to your request.  You can expect to receive an initial response by 6/8/2023.  If it is not practically possible to provide the requested records or to determine their availability within five working days, FOIA allows for UVA to request an additional seven working days.  Va. Code § 2.2-3704(A)(4).  If additional time, beyond the seven-work-day period, is needed in order to fulfill your request, we will make reasonable efforts to reach an agreement with you for records production as required under FOIA.  Va. Code §§ 2.2-3700 and 2.2-3704(C). Additionally, UVA may recover its actual costs incurred in processing your request.  This includes costs incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for the records you have requested, including, but not limited to, the costs of reviewing records to determine whether or not they are public records responsive to your request, exempt under FOIA, or may not lawfully be disclosed pursuant to some other provision of law (See Va. Code §2.2-3704(F)). If costs are likely to exceed $200, as permitted by FOIA, we do require advanced payment prior to fulfilling a request.  Va. Code § 2.2-3704(H).  If costs are likely to be less than $200, actual costs incurred by UVA will be billed to you after you receive your response.  In either case, I will let you know of any costs in advance. Thank you for contacting this office.  Please let me know if you have any questions. Sincerely, Freedom of Information Act Officer University of Virginia www.virginia.edu/foia

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request #V003041-060123
communications.communication:
Thank you for the data you sent me, however it is only partially what I am seeking. It appears to be each employees' "official salary or rate of pay" but I did not receive accounting records showing their total aggregate payments received each year.

As stated in my original request: 
I am also requesting accounting records from 01/01/2012 to present showing name and aggregate total annual (calendar year preferred, but fiscal year acceptable) payments made to any individuals with the word 'perfusion' in their job title as well.

I discussed my request with the Virginia FOIA council and they advised: "Generally speaking, accounting records showing payments made to an individual would be open to public disclosure, but notations regarding the type of pay or reasons for payment may be withheld as personnel information. Please see AO-01-21 which discussed salary/rate of pay, payroll, and accounting records in detail."

I look forward to receiving these files, thank you.

communications.communication: Dear Tom: I am writing to acknowledge receipt by the University of Virginia of your request for records under the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), Va. Code § 2.2-3700 et seq., for the following records: Thank you for the data you sent me, however it is only partially what I am seeking. It appears to be each employees' "official salary or rate of pay" but I did not receive accounting records showing their total aggregate payments received each year. As stated in my original request: I am also requesting accounting records from 01/01/2012 to present showing name and aggregate total annual (calendar year preferred, but fiscal year acceptable) payments made to any individuals with the word 'perfusion' in their job title as well. I discussed my request with the Virginia FOIA council and they advised: "Generally speaking, accounting records showing payments made to an individual would be open to public disclosure, but notations regarding the type of pay or reasons for payment may be withheld as personnel information. Please see AO-01-21 which discussed salary/rate of pay, payroll, and accounting records in detail." I look forward to receiving these files, thank you. Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-of-virginia-3079%252Fu-va-perfusion-salary-request-146776%252F%253Femail%253Duniversityofvirginia%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAT5o6A4QBs6i_7TkENuxVN0uo%3A1qDdeh%3AXHlLu0d3_1VK3FyLajyMB6gcxwr9lqhhencEETPeHsQ Under FOIA, UVA has five working days to respond to your request.  You can expect to receive an initial response by 7/3/2023.  If it is not practically possible to provide the requested records or to determine their availability within five working days, FOIA allows for UVA to request an additional seven working days.  Va. Code § 2.2-3704(A)(4).  If additional time, beyond the seven-work-day period, is needed in order to fulfill your request, we will make reasonable efforts to reach an agreement with you for records production as required under FOIA.  Va. Code §§ 2.2-3700 and 2.2-3704(C). Additionally, UVA may recover its actual costs incurred in processing your request.  This includes costs incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for the records you have requested, including, but not limited to, the costs of reviewing records to determine whether or not they are public records responsive to your request, exempt under FOIA, or may not lawfully be disclosed pursuant to some other provision of law (See Va. Code §2.2-3704(F)). If costs are likely to exceed $200, as permitted by FOIA, we do require advanced payment prior to fulfilling a request.  Va. Code § 2.2-3704(H).  If costs are likely to be less than $200, actual costs incurred by UVA will be billed to you after you receive your response.  In either case, I will let you know of any costs in advance. Thank you for contacting this office.  Please let me know if you have any questions. Sincerely, Freedom of Information Act Officer University of Virginia www.virginia.edu/foia

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
July 13, 2023 Dear Tom Nash: 

I am writing in response to your recent request for records under the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), Va. Code § 2.2-3700 et seq., for the following records: 
 Thank you for the data you sent me, however it is only partially what I am seeking. It appears to be each employees' "official salary or rate of pay" but I did not receive accounting records showing their total aggregate payments received each year. As stated in my original request: I am also requesting accounting records from 01/01/2012 to present showing name and aggregate total annual (calendar year preferred, but fiscal year acceptable) payments made to any individuals with the word 'perfusion' in their job title as well. I discussed my request with the Virginia FOIA council and they advised: "Generally speaking, accounting records showing payments made to an individual would be open to public disclosure, but notations regarding the type of pay or reasons for payment may be withheld as personnel information. Please see AO-01-21 which discussed salary/rate of pay, payroll, and accounting records in detail." I look forward to receiving these files, thank you. Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-of-virginia-3079%252Fu-va-perfusion-salary-request-146776%252F%253Femail%253Duniversityofvirginia%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAT5o6A4QBs6i_7TkENuxVN0uo%3A1qDdeh%3AXHlLu0d3_1VK3FyLajyMB6gcxwr9lqhhencEETPeHsQ numerous systems and the University would incur actual costs to produce these records. 
Attached you will find records responsive to your request.  As noted in our response to your previous case V003045, records prior to 2018 are housed in  Va. Code §2.2-3704(F) provides that a “public body may make reasonable charges not to exceed its actual cost” in fulfilling a FOIA request and, “shall make all reasonable efforts to supply the requested records at the lowest possible cost.”  Further, public bodies shall “inquire of the requester whether he would like to request a cost estimate in advance of the supplying of the requested records.” Any costs we incur in estimating the cost of supplying the requested records shall be applied toward the overall charges to be paid for the supplying of such requested record.”  In this case, the University can provide a free estimate of costs, provided below broken down by category and date range.  
 
  *  Name, Title, Salary for medical center employees employed on 6/30 of each year 2011 – 2015 $560 
  *  Name, Title, Salary for medical center employees employed on 6/30 of each year 2016 - 2018 $280 Name, Title, Salary for academic division employees employed on 6/30 of each year 2011 – 2018 $560 You may also login to the University of Virginia Public Records Center to view and download the records at any time: https://foia.virginia.edu/request-records  . Your username is 146776-04087503@requests.muckrock.com.  If you are a first-time user, you will need to setup your password. 

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you for contacting this office. 

Sincerely, Freedom of Information Act Officer University of Virginia 
www.virginia.edu/foia

title: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Community Public Safety Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Kemp's office on June 8, 2023, the Governor's office awarded more than $83.5 million in grants for 118 qualified projects as part of the Community Public Safety Grant program. This included a grant of $1,548,305 to the South Fulton Police Department described in additional documents provided by the Governor: https://gov.georgia.gov/sites/gov.georgia.gov/files/2023-06/Grantee%20List%20for%20Public%20Safety%20Release1024_9_0.jpg

Press Release: https://gov.georgia.gov/press-releases/2023-06-08/gov-kemp-announces-835m-community-public-safety-grant-awards#:~:text=In%20accordance%20with%20grant%20requirements,violence%20resulting%20from%20the%20pandemic.

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents from the "Community Public Safety Grant" program for the grant of $1,548,305 received by the South Fulton Police Department, as described in the Governor's press release and additional documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

title: FOIA Request: Inspection Reports and Citations for Tobacco Worker Complaints (Department of Labor)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: Inspection Reports and Citations for Tobacco Worker Complaints (Department of Labor)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern, 

I would like to request the inspection reports and any citations for the following complaints filed by tobacco farmworkers to the Department of Labor’s Occupational Safety and Health Administration. 

-UPA# F-1652858, Polek Brothers Tobacco, LLC, UPA Receipt Date 08/31/2020, Inspection Report #1491322
-UPA# F-1634336, J-J Thompson Farms, Inc., UPA Receipt Date 07/27/2020, Inspection Report #1485657
-UPA# F-1788300, Derek Smith Farms, UPA Receipt Date 07/17/2021, Inspection Report #1543120
-UPA# F-1805387, J-J Thompson Farms, Inc., UPA Receipt Date, 08/30//2021, Inspection Report #1551430
-UPA# R-1473394, RICH FARMS, INC., UPA Receipt Date 07/08/2019, Inspection Report #1414909
-UPA# R-1796330, Horace Randy Wood, UPA Receipt Date 08/10/2021

I am a journalist with Civil Eats, and this will be used to further my reporting on health and safety issues pertaining to farmworkers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the state open records law N.M. Stat. Secs. 14-2-1 to 14-2-12, I write to request access to and a copy of each Use of Force Report, which I understand is comprised of a Use of Force Data Report and a Use of Force Narrative Report, by New Mexico State Police from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022, including the following data but not limited to

- Date, time: The date (month, day, year) and time of the incident
- Location: Street address, block, and other relevant location information
- Subject(s) information: race, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, resultant or related injuries sustained or alleged, weapon type (if applicable) in the possession of each involved individual, arrests or charges associated with the incident
- Officer information (for each involved officer): employee number or other unique identifier used for the officer, race, resultant or related physical injuries, patrol division, unit
- Incident details: incident or other unique identification number for the use of force incident
- Type of force details: a description of each type of force used
- Body camera or other footage: Inventory of any video record was created of the incident and/or a copy of the captured footage from all present cameras
- Disposition of investigation into the incident: The current or final status of each use of force incident, including whether challenges to the use of force were sustained or dismissed or if the incident had no or is currently under investigation

Please provide the information as a csv spreadsheet, if possible, and if not possible, please provide incident reports sufficient to show the requested data. For reference, I made the same request for years 2015 to 2020 and that request was fulfilled under Reference number P007332-110521.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock staff reporter Dillon Bergin: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of NMDPS. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of New Mexico Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 3/14/2023 and given the reference number P023972-031423 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:
Pursuant to the state open records law N.M. Stat. Secs. 14-2-1 to 14-2-12, I write to request access to and a copy of each Use of Force Report, which I understand is comprised of a Use of Force Data Report and a Use of Force Narrative Report, by New Mexico State Police from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022, including the following data but not limited to
- Date, time: The date (month, day, year) and time of the incident
- Location: Street address, block, and other relevant location information
- Subject(s) information: race, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, resultant or related injuries sustained or alleged, weapon type (if applicable) in the possession of each involved individual, arrests or charges associated with the incident
- Officer information (for each involved officer): employee number or other unique identifier used for the officer, race, resultant or related physical injuries, patrol division, unit
- Incident details: incident or other unique identification number for the use of force incident
- Type of force details: a description of each type of force used
- Body camera or other footage: Inventory of any video record was created of the incident and/or a copy of the captured footage from all present cameras
- Disposition of investigation into the incident: The current or final status of each use of force incident, including whether challenges to the use of force were sustained or dismissed or if the incident had no or is currently under investigation
Please provide the information as a csv spreadsheet, if possible, and if not possible, please provide incident reports sufficient to show the requested data. For reference, I made the same request for years 2015 to 2020 and that request was fulfilled under Reference number P007332-110521.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Dillon Bergin 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek, and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability of records, and/or provided with copies of the records in question within 15 days. If there are associated costs you will be notified, and must pay prior to receipt of the records. 
Any responsive records will be provided immediately if records have been located, they are public records, and there is no associated charge. Otherwise, within 15 days of your request, you will be notified if the DPS has encountered difficulties responding to your request, and provided the DPS’ estimate of when you will receive any records located. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center.

Secs. 14-2-1 to 14-2-12, I write to request access to and a copy of each Use of Force Report, which I understand is comprised of a Use of Force Data Report and a Use of Force Narrative Report, by New Mexico State Police from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022, including the following data but not limited to 
- Date, time: The date (month, day, year) and time of the incident 
- Location: Street address, block, and other relevant location information 
- Subject(s) information: race, ethnicity, national origin, age, gender, resultant or related injuries sustained or alleged, weapon type (if applicable) in the possession of each involved individual, arrests or charges associated with the incident 
- Officer information (for each involved officer): employee number or other unique identifier used for the officer, race, resultant or related physical injuries, patrol division, unit 
- Incident details: incident or other unique identification number for the use of force incident 
- Type of force details: a description of each type of force used 
- Body camera or other footage: Inventory of any video record was created of the incident and/or a copy of the captured footage from all present cameras 
- Disposition of investigation into the incident: The current or final status of each use of force incident, including whether challenges to the use of force were sustained or dismissed or if the incident had no or is currently under investigation 
Please provide the information as a csv spreadsheet, if possible, and if not possible, please provide incident reports sufficient to show the requested data. For reference, I made the same request for years 2015 to 2020 and that request was fulfilled under Reference number P007332-110521. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires. 
Sincerely, 
Dillon Bergin" We are still working on your request, but due to the over burdensome nature of the request, additional preparation time is required for receiving all proper documentation, until 5/15/2023 5:00:00 PM.  We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause you and your patience in this matter is greatly appreciated. If you have any questions or need additional information, please feel free to contact my office at 505-470-2343. 
Sincerely, 
Daniel Stine 
Special Programs Supervisor 
LERB

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Multi-Vehicle car accident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Kindly provide us with the crash investigation material and crash photos for the accident that happened on I-5 NB MP 233.90 on 7/14/2023. The investigating police officer from WSP is Brent Mattox #1072 and the Report number is ED85473. We are working on behalf on the litigating attorney

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steve with Custard Insurance Adjusters

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Fusus
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to this press release from Fusus published on May 21, 2020, Georgia Tech police were using Fusus products: https://www.fusus.com/blog/press-release-police-departments-leverage-real-time-crime-center-in-the-cloud-to-adapt-to-covid-19-conditions

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Fusus signed between January 1, 2019 - May 5, 2023.

- All operating manuals, user guides, and training information for the use of Fusus products.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

The Office of Institute Communications of the Georgia Institute of Technology acknowledges your Open Records Act request, dated August 18, 2023, appearing below. communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Shared Mailboxes (email) (Lake County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A CSV export of your agency's Shared Mailboxes (see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/email/about-shared-mailboxes?view=o365-worldwide for more info ) including the following parameters for every shared mailbox:

- Primary SMTP Address
- Date Created

A simple way to retrieve this is by having a member of IT (such as a System Administrator) run the following command in Exchange Online PowerShell (if email is hosted in a Microsoft Exchange environment):

Get-Mailbox -ResultSize Unlimited -RecipientTypeDetails SharedMailbox | Select Name,PrimarySmtpAddress,WhenCreated | Export-CSV -Path .\SharedMailboxes_$((Get-Date).ToString('MM-dd-yyyy_hh-mm-ss')).csv

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: Use of UAV, CBP-104, on May 29, 2020

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Use of UAV, CBP-104, on May 29, 2020
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records pertaining to the flight of CBP's Unmanned Aerial System with registration CBP-104 ("CBP-104") from Grand Forks Air Force Base, North Dakota into and around the vicinity of Minneapolis, MN ("indicated city") on May 29, 2020 ("indicated date").

Records that should be considered responsive are: 

Any correspondence with the Minnesota National Guard or any law enforcement agency for use of CBP-104 around indicated city on indicated date;
Any audio-visual format data obtained around indicated city from CBP-104's electro-optical/infrared sensors  on indicated date; 
Any audio-visual format data obtained around indicated city from CBP-104's surface search radar/ground moving target indicator on indicated date;
Any audio-visual recording or transcripts of communications from any ground control station in charge of the CBP-104 flight around indicated city on indicated date; 
Any report or debriefing on the data obtained from CBP-104 around indicated city on indicated date, including those given to the staff of any government, law enforcement agency or to the Minnesota National Guard.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

title: Texas City Police - Arrest of Christopher Shull by Officer Scott Harrell - Chief's Text Messages

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas City Police - Arrest of Christopher Shull by Officer Scott Harrell - Chief's Text Messages
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any text message(s) controlled, maintained or archived by the Texas City Police Department or the City of Texas City, TX having the following requirements:

1)	Dates for the text message(s): Between May 26, 2023 to June 05, 2023.
2)	Any and all text message(s) sent or received on the Texas City Police Chief's Department Issued Cell Phone.
3)    Any and all text message(s) sent or received in the transaction of official business from Texas City Police Chief's Personal Cell Phone.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stuart Martin

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #2023-960
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The information you requested contains the home address, home telephone number, emergency contact information, social security number, and/or family member information of a public employee or official, and/or information pertaining to a pending case, investigation, or prosecution of a crime. As allowed by section 552.024 and 552.108(a)(1) of the Texas Government Code, our office is prohibited by law from releasing this personal information to you, and therefore we have removed this information from the enclosed information we are providing to you.

Normally, we must request a ruling from the Texas Attorney General before we can withhold any of the information you requested. However, section 552.024 and 552.108(a)(1) allows us to withhold this specific information without requesting a ruling from the attorney general.

You have the right to appeal our decision to withhold this information from you. Instructions for appeal are at the end of this email. If you do not want to appeal, you do not need to do anything else. Please note that we are only withholding the specific categories of information that are confidential under section 552.024 and 552.108(a)(1). We have processed the rest of your request for information in accordance with the terms of the Public Information Act.

Please use this link to access the requested documents: [​Folder icon]  2023-960<https://tcgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/rjackson_texascitytx_gov/EsPWTsPytbVLhRYsq4Dk-yUBc6lT_tK_l24mE4pP0q6_XQ?e=5zc4eI>



How to appeal the withholding of information under Gov’t Code section 552.024

If you wish to appeal the withholding of information discussed on the previous page, you must send the following to the attorney general:

1) a signed, written statement indicating your wish to appeal the withholding of information;

2) the name of the governmental body that withheld information from you;

3) the date you made your original request for information; and

4) a copy of your original request for information, or if you are unable to provide a copy, a description of your original request for information.

You may also submit written comments stating why you think the information should be released to you, but you are not required to do so.

Send your appeal by mail to the attorney general at:

Open Records Division

P.O. Box 12548

Austin, Texas 78711-2548
Within forty-five business days after receiving all of the above-listed items necessary to file your appeal, the attorney general will issue a written ruling on the matter. You will receive a copy of this ruling in the mail.


Many thanks,
Rhomari Leigh, TRMC

DISCLAIMER: This email (plus any attachments) is a public record of the City of Texas City and may subject to public disclosure under the Texas Public Information Act.

title: Open Records Request: Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release from Gov. Mike DeWine's office, the Mercer County Sheriff received a grant of $110,640.70 as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program: https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/OHIOGOVERNOR/2023/02/22/file_attachments/2416264/Violent%20Crime%20Reduction%20Program%20Grant%20Summaries%20through%20R12.pdf

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the Mercer County Sheriff's grant of $110,640.70 as part of the Ohio Violent Crime Reduction Grant program described in the press release linked above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

title: Contracts, Vendor Payment Report, Invoices - CA's Mortgage Settlement Monitor

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Contracts, Vendor Payment Report, Invoices - CA's Mortgage Settlement Monitor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following records pertaining to compensation or other expenditures directed to or claimed by Ms. Katherine M. Porter, appointed as California's monitor of the nationwide housing settlement in March 2012 by then-California Attorney General Kamala Harris:

(1) two contracts (including a series of five amendments to one of them)
(2) a vendor payment report; and
(3) 24 invoices sent to the Department of Justice pursuant to the contracts

There should be no need to conduct a lengthy search, as these are the exact records that were identified, enumerated, and subsequently provided free of charge in PDF form in 2018 by then-Deputy Attorney General Paul Stein, in response to a CPRA request first submitted by Kristopher Anderson on March 15, 2018 and further clarified by Mr. Anderson on March 26, 2018 (SEE PRA-2018-00629, California Attorney General CPRA requests in 2018 (January-July), available online at https://archive.org/details/5682291-California-Ag-Cpra-Log-201801-201807/page/n215/mode/2up).  

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.
